data.description: The CIA spent $15 million to train a cat to spy on Russians. Just after it was released on its mission, the cat was killed by a car.
New Yorks area code is 212 because it was the fastest number to dial on a rotary phone

While James Cameron was stricken with food poisoning in Rome on a film set, he had a nightmare about an invincible robot hit man sent from the future to kill him giving him the idea for the Terminator catapulting his career.
Stan Lee created Iron Man because he thought no one would like him.
A baseball player only needs to spend one day in the major leagues to earn free healthcare for life.
The pallbearers at Billy Mays funeral wore blue shirts and khaki pants in tribute.
The original Ghostbusters trailer featured a 1-800 number, not a 555 number, which led to a prerecording of Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd. They got 1,000 calls per hour, 24 hours a day, for six weeks.
Even in todays sitcoms, a large percentage of the people in the laugh-track have since passed away. Meaning that we watch comedies marked by the laughter of dead people.

ESPN currently pays the NFL about $105 million dollars for the rights to air each Monday Night game. That means airing one game costs more than the budget of Minority Report ($102 million) or a whole slew of other blockbusters.
Over 10% of people have had sex at work.
Gordon Ramsay loved In N Out so much, after he finished his burger he went through the drive thru and ordered the same meal again to take home.
Leonidas of Sparta was not a young man at the Battle of Thermopylae. He was actually around 60 years old.

Before escaping prison, Winston Churchill left a letter of apology on his bed. The letter began: I have the honour to inform you that as I do not consider that your Government have any right to detain me as a military prisoner, I have decided to...
A professional rugby player had his scrotum torn open during a match, had it sewn back together on the bench, and finished the match.
A woman was caught making meth inside of a Walmart, while it was open.
75% of IKEAs product images are not photographs
When Bono was 14, his mother died at her fathers funeral
Tiny pseudoscorpions (about 4mm) live inside old books, effectively protecting them by eating book lice and dust mites.
Members of Westboro Baptist Church have been specifically banned from entering Canada for hate speech.

Nike made a commercial depicting a Samburu tribesman saying Just Do it in his native language. An American anthropologist called them out. The spoken phrase actually meant, I dont want these, give me big shoes. Nikes response: We thought...

Jack Daniels sent a cease & desist letter to an author who blatantly mimicked their label for his book cover 2 years ago, but instead of being angrily demanding, Jack Daniels offered to pay for the cost of reprinting the book

North Korea enlists around 2000 women as part of a Pleasure Squad. These are attractive women who provide entertainment and sexual services for top officials. One defector says Kim Jong-il was sentimental when drunk, and even shed tears
The FBI assigned a team to Sacha Baron Cohen during the filming of Borat due to numerous reports of a Middle eastern man traveling the Midwest in an ice cream truck. (video)
Chewing gum is primarily made of rubber and plastic. (video)
Porn sites are actually statistically the sites with the least chance of infecting you with malware.

According to the FBI Director, the FBI is having a hard time filling positions to help tackle cyber crimes because a lot of the nations top computer programmers and hacking gurus are also fond of marijuana.

In 1963, a man knocked down a wall of his home. Behind it, he discovered a mysterious room and soon discovered an intricate tunnel system with additional cave-like rooms. What he had discovered was the ancient Derinkuyu underground city in...
Wolverine was supposed to have a cameo in Spider-Man (2002). Hugh Jackman even flew to New York, but the scene had to be scrapped because his costume was nowhere to be found.
Prairie Dogs say hello to each other with little kisses
The lowest class of meat called Canner is used for dog food and school lunches.

Good Will Hunting originally had a gay sex scene in it because Matt Damon and Ben Affleck were sure that no studio executives were actually reading the script. Harvey Weinstein was the only person who said something about the scene.

Singer Tom Waits successfully sued the LAPD. He was wrongfully arrested for disturbing the peace when, outside a coffee shop, he intervened a group of men who were bullying other patrons. The bullies were plainclothes officers.

In 1963, a man knocked down a wall of his home. Behind it, he discovered a mysterious room and soon discovered an intricate tunnel system with additional cave-like rooms. What he had discovered was the ancient Derinkuyu underground city in...
A man called Paz snuck into Paris Hiltons 30th birthday party, stole her $3200 red velvet cake, and gave it away to the homeless of Los Angeles.
There is a man who, due to auto-brewery syndrome, will get drunk from eating bread
Michael Jackson admired Eminem as an artist but was disappointed when the rapper made fun of him in Just Lose It and said that Ive never attacked a fellow artist. Great artists dont do that. (video)
Beats by Dre headphones, which sell for as much as $450, only cost about $14 to make.
Iggy Azalea is the only artist since the Beatles whose first two Hot 100 hits have ranked first and second simultaneously.
J.K. Rowling was asked to use her initials instead of her full name (Joanne Rowling) because her publishers were worried that boys wouldnt want to read a book written by a woman
Donald Trump proposed a one-time tax on the wealthiest 1% to eliminate the national debt.
Snapchat was originally marketed as an app to send nude pictures called Picaboo
The richest woman in Germany met her future husband while she was working in an apprenticeship at BMW under a fake name.
Al Capone was responsible for expiration dates on milk jugs.
Jim Carrey sucked on Shannon Whirrys real boob which had milk in them in Me, Myself & Irene. He felt so humiliated that he had to clear the set before each take.

Howard Stern ran for Governor of New York in 1994 promising to limit road work to night hours. He eventually withdrew, but later that year, The Howard Stern Bill was signed into law which limited road construction in New York City and Long Island to...

In 1988, Cosmopolitan released an article saying that women should not worry about contracting HIV from infected men and that most heterosexuals are not at risk, claiming it was impossible to transmit HIV in the missionary position.
